summary: Skyre Reproccer .xml file for Skyre+Immersive Weapons, Bosmer Armor Pack and other mods. Tweaked by me, fixing issues with weapons arrows and armor using the base Balbor and Steelsouls preset.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#ff0000][size=3][b][u]First of all understand that english is not my mother language, so sorry about mispelling :) Also, this is the first thing I'm uploading.[/u][/b][/size][/color]

[center][color=#548dd4][size=3][b][u]Description[/u][/b][/size][/color][/center]
I've made this tweaks based on the Balbour and Steelsouls .xml preset. At first It was for immersive weapons mainly but also fixes some inconsistences with Skyre+Skyrim vanilla.

Post V0.7 everything was reworked again into Xathra's .xml to be compatible with his mod as is the only being continuously updated. 

It's a pain in the bal** changing stats and running again Skyrim over and over to see the real values. TES5Edit don't give you the absolute values, since  the stats depends on the .xml which is only loaded after you start the game.
Please understand that this is a "domino effect", when you change one item, you will have to change 3,4,5 or more items too.

And finally, I'M NOT A REAL MODDER I only understand how the .xml works because I'm a bit familiar with the syntax, also you don't have to be a genious to edit the file.


[center][color=#548dd4][size=3][u][b]I don't care about the story of your life, tell me what does this file[/b][/u][/size][/color][/center]

It fixes wrong values on armor, weapons and arrows In Vanilla Skyrim + SkyRe and all covered mods. The idea is to have more diversity instead of +20 armor sets / weapons with the same stats in each tree.

[center][color=#548dd4][size=3][u][b]Mods Covered[/b][/u][/size][/color][/center]


Skyre
Immersive Weapons
Immersive Armors
Bosmer Armor Pack
Elemental Arrows
Lore Weapon Expansion
Ghosu's Weapon Pack
Noldor Content Pack

[color=#ff0000][b][u]Mandatory Mods:[/u][/b] The only mandatory mod for the .xml to work is SkyRe. All the other mods mentioned are not necessary, you can still use the file without any problem. Post V 0.7 You need to install Xathra's Patches (see installation section).

[/color]


[center][size=3][color=#548dd4][b][u]What did I use as a base for the tweaks[/u][/b][/color][/size][/center]

At first, the Balbor and Steelsouls .xml which is the "base", but most of the time I have to manually add items inside the file. Balbor and Steelsouls doesn't come with all the vanilla items, not all the immersive armors / weapons items, and any other new mod is not supported, so I have to add the new stuff.

Second, logic: if an item is more difficult to craft, most of the times it should be better than an easy craftable one.

And Third, if I can, the intended values which comes from the mod author's page or the original Skyrim stats.

In extreme situations I even do a google research, lol. (it happened a few times)

[color=#ff0000][b][u]NOTE:[/u][/b] The damages represented here are based on a "clean" character with no perks but smithing. The values WILL change depending on which perks you've chosen.

[/color]


[center][color=#548dd4][size=3][b][u]Compatibility[/u][/b][/size][/color][/center]

It's a stats file so it's compatible with anything that doesn't change the stats.xml.



[color=#00b050][b]Installation:[/b][/color]
Drop the .xml in Skyrim/Data/SkyProc Patchers/T3nd0_ReProccer/ReProccer
[color=#ff0000][b][u]NOTE:[/u][/b][/color] Make sure you backup the original first. Seriously, do a backup.
Run Reproccer. Otherwise you won't notice any changes.

Mod Organizer compatible? It should. Just make sure you "load" this mod after Skyre and Xathra's mod.

[color=#00b050][b]Uninstallation:[/b][/color]
Replace with the backup one. Run Reproccer. If you don't have for some stupid reason the original .xml, go to the Balbor and Steelsouls page, there it is :D

Using Mod Organizer? No need to restore anything as the program never overwrites files. Just deactivate this mod and you're done.

[color=#ff0000]Make sure you check the "force patch" option in your Reproccer patcher before patching for both installing and uninstalling[/color]

[color=#ff0000][size=3][b][u]ATENTION FOR VERSION 0.8 AND UP[/u][/b][/size][/color]

[color=#ff0000]For the installation of V0.8 and up, you need to complete unninstall Balbor and Steelsouls patches, since they're outdated. You need to install xathra's patches (see link below). Otherwise IT WILL NOT WORK[/color]

[color=#548dd4][b][u]xathra's patches[/u][/b][/color]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/48629/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/48629/?[/url]

[color=#00b050][b]Once you have installed his patches, the instalation process for the .xml is the same as older verions[/b][/color]


[center][color=#548dd4][size=3][b][u]Help Section / Recommendations for the installation[/u][/b][/size][/color][/center]

*Run BOSS or any other program to sort your load order before running Reproccer. Have in mind that some .esps may still be not sorted correctly. Always check in the official mod author's page where the .esp needs to be in your load order.

*Run Reproccer WITHOUT BOSS, there's a file called "noBOSS" in your Reproccer folder, always run that one. Otherwise it will sort your load order again and any manual change you've done will be lost.
The latest Reproccer version does not use BOSS. It should only patch, not sort.

*If you need to re-make you reproccer.esp make sure you check the "force patch" option in the program's window. Sometimes the only way to remake the patch is just delete the old .esp and create a new one.

*If you use Dual sheath redux, you may have issues like "X file have some missing masters: Y" The way to fix that is checking for that specific .esp and load it before the "master".

*[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29865/?]SUM[/url] is recommended in case you have multiple patchers. It takes time but, the program will run every patcher for you in the correct order.


[center][b][color=#f79646]>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>><<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<[/color][/b][/center]


[center][color=#548dd4][size=3][b][u]What did I changed so far[/u][/b][/size][/color][/center]

[color=#548dd4][b][u]Changelog[/u][/b][/color]

[center][color=#548dd4][b](Download the Complete List of changes with explanations and mind-blowing in the miscellaneous section. See The Brief and healthy list of changes in the ReadMe section)[/b][/color][/center]

[b]V0.1[/b]
*Initial release
[b]V0.2[/b] (06/25/13)

[b]V0.5[/b] (06/29/13)

[b]V0.6[/b] (07/17/13)

[b]V0.7[/b] (12/17/13)

[b]V0.8[/b] (02/19/14)

[b]V0.9[/b] (03/16/14)

[b]V1.0[/b] (05/03/14)
*Final release for IA and IW

[b]V1.1[/b] (08/30/14)
*Support for Lore Weapon Expansion

[b]V1.2[/b] (12/10/14)
*Support for Ghosu's Weapon Pack (requires Xathra compatibility .esp) and Noldor Content Pack



[b][size=3]And that will be all.[/size][/b]

If you have any kind of suggestion, feel free to let me know in the comments. I will still be making changes or improvements if I can.

Also, it's impossible not to have 2 items with the same damages/armor rating when you have so many. Not even Bethesda did that with their vanilla+dlc stuff. I will keep balancing items the best I can, but you will find that some of them will have same stats as others.


[color=#ff0000][b][u]SIDE NOTE:[/u][/b][/color]

Xathra has my .xml as an optional download. It is outdated, though. It was not updated since his 2.2 version.

[center][b][color=#548dd4][size=3][u]Credits:[/u][/size][/color][/b][/center]

xathra for his up to date patches
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/48629/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/48629/?[/url]

Balbor and Steelsouls for the old .xml
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27092/?]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27092/?[/url]

T3nd0 for the amazing Skyre and the Reproccer patcher
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/9286/?]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/9286/?[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/28467/?]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/28467/?[/url]

hothtrooper44 for such a good mods. Immersive weapons and armors
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27644//?]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27644//?[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/19733//?]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/19733//?[/url]

maty743 for a really nice mod. Bosmer Armor Pack
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/37289/?]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/37289/?[/url]

Elemental Arrows by Fuma
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49983/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49983/?

[/url]Lore Weapon Expansion by InsanitySorrow and Elvarheim
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/44179/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/44179/?

[/url]Ghosu's Weapon Pack by Ghosu
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/28545/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/28545/?[/url]

Noldor Content Pack By Maty743
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58656/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58656/?

[/url]Skyforge Weapons By Dreogan
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36815/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36815/?[/url]
